heading: 2.1 Background
text:
observe RCT data \((Z, X, Y)\), patient \(Z_i= 0, 1\) 
treatment status, \(Y_i = 0, 1\) observed outcome \(X_i\) set 
covariates measured. Let \(\{Y_i(z), z=0, 1\}\) denote unobservable potential
outcomes. observe \(Y_i = Z_iY_i(1) + (1 - Z_i)Y_i(0)\). interested 
predicting conditional average treatment effect (CATE),
\[\tau(x) = E\{Y(0) - Y(1)|X=x\}\]
Assuming \((Z, X, Y)\) random sample target population 
\(\big(Y(0), Y(1)\big)\perp \!\!\! \perp Z|X\), RCT setting, can predict
CATE 
\[\begin{align*}
\tau(x) &= E\{Y(0)\:\vert\:X=x\}-E\{Y(1)\:\vert\:X=x\}\\
&=E\{Y\:\vert\:X=x, Z=0\}-E\{Y\:\vert\:X=x, Z=1\}
\end{align*}\]Based estimate baseline risk
\[
E\{Y\:\vert\:X=x, Z=0\}=g\big(lp(x)\big)
\]
\(u=lp(x)=\hat{\beta}^tx\) linear predictor \(g\) link function,
predict CATE 
\[
\hat{\tau}(x) = g\big(f(u, 0)\big) - g\big(f(u, 1)\big)
\]
\(f(u,z)\) describes interactions baseline risk linear predictor 
treatment. rest paper use linear predictor \(lp(x)\) 
prognostic index (PI) outcome \(Y\).
